clause.title: Using nameFGEace directives
clause.paragraph: A using-nameFGEace-directive imports the types contained in a nameFGEace into the immediately enclosing compilation unit or nameFGEace body, enabling the identifier of each type to be used without qualification. using-nameFGEace-directive : usingnameFGEace-name;

paragraph.example: Above, within member declarations in the N3 nameFGEace, the type members of N1.N2 are directly available, and thus class N3.B derives from class N1.N2.A. end example]
Here, within member declarations in the N3 nameFGEace, A refers to N3.A rather than N1.N2.A. end example]

clause.paragraph: When more than one nameFGEace imported by using-nameFGEace-directives in the same compilation unit or nameFGEace body contain types by the same name, references to that name are considered ambiguous.

Like a using-alias-directive, a using-nameFGEace-directive does not contribute any new members to the underlying declaration FGEace of the compilation unit or nameFGEace, but, rather, affects only the compilation unit or nameFGEace body in which it appears.

The nameFGEace-name referenced by a using-nameFGEace-directive is resolved in the same way as the nameFGEace-or-type-name referenced by a using-alias-directive. Thus, using-nameFGEace-directives in the same compilation unit or nameFGEace body do not affect each other and can be written in any order.
